column5: where can I get Topographical maps of Canadian lakes such as Longbow (near Kenora) and Kramer (near Redditt)?
try this site- links to another map place to figure out which one you need.http://www.latitudesmapstore.com/template.cfm

Tjsker,Have never fished Longbow Lake,but have fished Kramer since 1978 and have never been able to find a topo map of it.Will tell you all my fishing spots on Kramer, if you want to talk you can e-mail me at [email protected]
You can try this site for the map you need.If it is not listed, e-mail themhttp://www.kenoramarina.com

I fish Longbow about 4-5 times a summer. I find that it is a really easy lake to fish. There is really no chance of getting lost. But if you are looking for a good map then go to www.canadamapsales.com. I just picked up a map of that area. Which includes LOW and has depths, rocks, etc. It was waterproof and coastgaurd approved. It was only $20.00can I believe.When are you heading up that way?Fish ON!!Fish ON!!
Tony, I just checked your profile, are you any relation to John Jerina? I have been coresponding with him about the same lake. Just wondern'.Fish ON!!
John Jerina?Yes, he's my cousin. But try to keep it a secret. We don't like to associate with such rif-raf. LOL
I second the post for www.canadamapsales.com It is a government of Manitoba internet store. You can get lake maps for Manitoba and Ontario there, and quads for all of Canada.
